translation.title: An Expert in the Monastic Law (1st)

next.name: An Expert in the Monastic Law (2nd)

segments.en: 75. An Expert in the Monastic Law (1st)

segments.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu vinayadharo hoti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities is an expert in the monastic law.
They know what is an offense.
They know what is not an offense.
They know what is a light offense.
They know what is a serious offense.

segments.pli: sīlavā hoti pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu,
segments.en: They’re ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.

segments.pli: catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
segments.en: They get the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty.

segments.pli: āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu vinayadharo hotī”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these seven qualities is an expert in the monastic law.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities is an expert…

suttaplex.blurb: An expert in monastic conduct has seven qualities.
